message: Kind of book?  tutorial, reference, cookbook
by Jonathan Chaffer - author
Learning your subject quickly is good if you don't have deep knowledge of it
Co-Wrote a "Learning jQuery" and many other jQuery books.
Getting Started - Can you write?  Do you like writing? Any past writing experience? If not, you should start!
Start blogging to get started
Even mediocre writers are better than none (good to be first one on the subject).
Getting paid - you will get an advance; royalties to against the advance; royalties on gross vs net, MSRP vs wholesale
Why write a book?  Money, Fame, To Enrich the Commons, To Learn, To Spread the Word, Insanity
Finding a publisher - Big or small; traditional or print-on-demand; vanity presses (you fund the printing costs)
Sometimes the publisher finds you (they look for people who blog on the topic they are interested in)
Make backups!
You need some special knowledge for technical writing
The copyright belongs to the publisher, not you
- forever
Signing a contract  - advance and royalties; schedule; copyright; right of refusal; future editions
Will rights revert back to the author after a period of time?  Check contract.
Write something every day!
Don't forget your taxes if you make money
Having someone keep you accountable on your deadline
Use version control for your code and your actual text documents
Test your code frequently if doing technical writing
A book is like software - you have to support it
